sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a rectangle.
message_1: A rectangle has a length of 10 cm and a width of 7 cm. What is the perimeter of the rectangle?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of a rectangle, you can use the formula P = 2(L + W), where P is the perimeter, L is the length, and W is the width. 

In this case, the length (L) is 10 cm and the width (W) is 7 cm. 

So, the perimeter (P) is:

P = 2(10 + 7)
P = 2(17)
P = 34 cm

The perimeter of the rectangle is 34 cm.
